title: Admin web sessions remain active after logout of Shopify ID

profile.name: Shopify
profile.about: Shopify is a multi-channel commerce platform that helps people sell online, in-store, and everywhere in between.

vulnerability_information:
previously on #837729 a session is still valid and the store password can be seen.

this time I report that the session is still valid despite changing the email address on the shopify account.

## summary: accounts that have changed email addresses still have permission to enter the store through another browser, so old emails can still have access to the store

## steps for reproduction
1. Change your account email (the account has handled several stores) and confirm (I use Firefox)
2. The email account has been successfully replaced
3. open another browser (chrome beta) and log in with the old email, here you are asked to enter the code from the email and you have successfully logged in the account
4. Try opening your shop and logging in with your old email (here I was directed to enter and still have full access, even after changing my email address).

please see the https://150hy.myshopify.com store (test store) and ████@wearehackerone.com and ██████+top@wearehackerone.com accounts (password = ██████████)

## Impact

access not revoke after changed email address on accounts shopify
vulnerability_information_html:
previously on #837729 a session is still valid and the store password can be seen.

this time I report that the session is still valid despite changing the email address on the shopify account.

summary: accounts that have changed email addresses still have permission to enter the store through another browser, so old emails can still have access to the store

steps for reproduction

  1. Change your account email (the account has handled several stores) and confirm (I use Firefox)
  2. The email account has been successfully replaced
  3. open another browser (chrome beta) and log in with the old email, here you are asked to enter the code from the email and you have successfully logged in the account
  4. Try opening your shop and logging in with your old email (here I was directed to enter and still have full access, even after changing my email address).

please see the https://150hy.myshopify.com store (test store) and ████@wearehackerone.com and ██████+top@wearehackerone.com accounts (password = ██████████)

Impact

access not revoke after changed email address on accounts shopify

activities.message:
a little extra if you experience reproductions problems
1. open chrome and create a shop with your account, the shop it active and you are out from chrome
2. Open Firefox and enter your account, change your email address and confirm
3. Open Chrome again and log in to your account (old email), then open the store that was created

activities.message:
Hi @██████████,
I have reviewed your videos and I am unable to reproduce this part of it:
> Open Chrome again and log in to your account (old email)

When I return to this session, the email is not found on accounts.shopify.com. 

Note that it is expected that previous sessions are not revoked when changing the email. Any previous sessions will still be active, so it is expected behaviour that you would still be logged into shops from before that change.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @██████████,
I have reviewed your videos and I am unable to reproduce this part of it:

Open Chrome again and log in to your account (old email)

When I return to this session, the email is not found on accounts.shopify.com.

Note that it is expected that previous sessions are not revoked when changing the email. Any previous sessions will still be active, so it is expected behaviour that you would still be logged into shops from before that change.

activities.message:
Hi @█████,
Thank you for your report. We have reproduced your issue. Note that this actually doesn't depend at all on changing the email address in your Shopify ID. You can reproduce this behaviour as follows:
* In a fresh session, log in to your Shopify ID and access a shop
* Logout of your Shopify ID directly on accounts.shopify.com
* Visit /admin on the shop and confirm that you still have access

Our engineering team is investigating, so we are marking this as triaged.

In the future, please make an effort to keep your report as simple as possible. Providing multiple videos in which you take unnecessary steps makes it much more difficult to triage.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @█████,
Thank you for your report. We have reproduced your issue. Note that this actually doesn't depend at all on changing the email address in your Shopify ID. You can reproduce this behaviour as follows:

  • In a fresh session, log in to your Shopify ID and access a shop
  • Logout of your Shopify ID directly on accounts.shopify.com
  • Visit /admin on the shop and confirm that you still have access

Our engineering team is investigating, so we are marking this as triaged.

In the future, please make an effort to keep your report as simple as possible. Providing multiple videos in which you take unnecessary steps makes it much more difficult to triage.

activities.message: @jenn-shopify I found a new method, where the user account (suspend staff) will be considered a partner account (collaborator), after the partner account has logged out, the suspend staff can enter the shop.
activities.markdown_message: @jenn-shopify I found a new method, where the user account (suspend staff) will be considered a partner account (collaborator), after the partner account has logged out, the suspend staff can enter the shop.

activities.message:
Hi @██████████,
There is no need to ask for updates, we will be sure to share any updates when we have them. We'll be contacting you soon about the bounty for this issue.

As far as the behaviour you mentioned with Collaborators:
> I also tested on store or collaborator (partner) accounts, and had the same impact.

> I found a new method, where the user account (suspend staff) will be considered a partner account (collaborator), after the partner account has logged out, the suspend staff can enter the shop.

Collaborator accounts are accessed via the Partners dashboard, and are not linked to a specific Shopify ID. If you think you have found a session issue with Collaborator accounts, please submit this in a separate report with clear steps to reproduce.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @██████████,
There is no need to ask for updates, we will be sure to share any updates when we have them. We'll be contacting you soon about the bounty for this issue.

As far as the behaviour you mentioned with Collaborators:

I also tested on store or collaborator (partner) accounts, and had the same impact.

I found a new method, where the user account (suspend staff) will be considered a partner account (collaborator), after the partner account has logged out, the suspend staff can enter the shop.

Collaborator accounts are accessed via the Partners dashboard, and are not linked to a specific Shopify ID. If you think you have found a session issue with Collaborator accounts, please submit this in a separate report with clear steps to reproduce.

additional_data.old_title: the session is still valid after changing the email address
additional_data.new_title: Admin web sessions remain active after logout of Shopify ID

activities.message:
Hi @███████,

Thanks again for your report. Though this does not explicitly fit into our common bounty categories, we have decided to award a bounty of $1000 for this report. This issue allows Shopify Admin web sessions to persist for up to two hours after logout from the associated Shopify ID, when these sessions should be terminated within 5 minutes.
activities.markdown_message:
Hi @███████,

Thanks again for your report. Though this does not explicitly fit into our common bounty categories, we have decided to award a bounty of $1000 for this report. This issue allows Shopify Admin web sessions to persist for up to two hours after logout from the associated Shopify ID, when these sessions should be terminated within 5 minutes.

activities.message: thanks for bounty
activities.markdown_message: thanks for bounty

activities.message:
Hey @███████!
Thanks again for your report! We have recently deployed a fix for this issue. Shopify Admin web sessions are now properly terminated after logging out of the associated Shopify ID. 

Thank you for hacking on Shopify, we hope to hear from you again soon!
activities.markdown_message:
Hey @███████!
Thanks again for your report! We have recently deployed a fix for this issue. Shopify Admin web sessions are now properly terminated after logging out of the associated Shopify ID.

Thank you for hacking on Shopify, we hope to hear from you again soon!
